questions.text: Which is the sign shown in the given radiograph?
questions.solution:
• The "dependent viscera sign" is a radiological finding seen on a chest X-ray or CT scan in cases of diaphragmatic injury.
  • It refers to the abnormal position of abdominal organs (viscera) that have herniated into the chest cavity due to a tear or rupture in the diaphragm. This sign is called "dependent" because the herniated organs appear to depend on or hang downward into the chest cavity.

Reference: Textbook of Radiology and Imaging by Sutton, Edition 8, Vol I,

questions.text: A 3-month-old male infant presented to the emergency department with a history of progressive difficulty in breathing over the past week. The mother reported that the baby had been experiencing increased coughing and rapid breathing. On examination, the infant appeared tachypneic with a respiratory rate of 60 breaths per minute. There were decreased breath sounds on the right side of the chest. A chest X-ray was performed as given below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Here Chest X ray revealing hyperinflation of the left upper lobe with mediastinal shift to the right. These findings were consistent with congenital lobar emphysema (CLE).

  • Congenital lobar emphysema (CLE) is a developmental anomaly of the respiratory tract that is characterized by hyperinflation of one or more of the pulmonary lobes most commonly the left upper lobe.
  • The most frequent cause of congenital lobar emphysema (CLE) is obstruction of the developing airway, leading to the creation of a "ball-valve" mechanism in which a greater volume of air enters the affected lobe during inspiration than leaves during expiration, producing air trapping
  • Theres no septal wall destruction,so congenital Lobar Emphysema is a misnomer,it is better called

Congenital Lobar Overinflation/Congenital Alveolar OverInflation

Reference: Textbook of Radiology and Imaging by Sutton, Edition 8, Vol I, Page number:175-176

questions.text: All of the features poisoning with the plant given in the image, except?
questions.solution:
Above plans is of Papavera Somniferous plant containing poppy seeds(opium).

Different parts of this plan is used to different Opioid products.

Poisoning with this causes

  • marked unresponsiveness,
  • coma
  • slow respiration
  • hypothermia,
  • hypotension
  • bradycardia

When presented with the clinical triad of coma, pinpoint pupils, and respiratory depression, clinicians should consider opioid overdose as a primary diagnosis.

Reference: Kaplan and Saddocks Synopsisi of Psychiatry, 11th Edition; Page number:1429

choices.text: Mask like Face of EPS side effects of 1st generation antipsychotic

questions.text: Below image shows ______ and seen in patients of_____?
questions.solution:
The Swiss neuropsychiatrist Otto Veraguth described a peculiar triangle-shaped fold in the nasal corner of the upper eyelid.

The fold is often associated with depression and referred to as Veraguth's fold. The photograph illustrates this physiognomic feature in a 50-year-old man during a major depressive episode. Veraguth's fold may also be seen in persons who are not clinically depressed, usually while they are harboring a mild depressive affect. Distinct changes in the tone of the corrugator and zygomatic facial muscles accompany depression, as shown on electromyograms.

Reference: Kaplan and Saddocks Synopsis of psychiatry, 11th Edition, Page number:788

questions.text: Disease caused by toxin of seeds of this plant?
questions.solution:
Epidemic Dropsy :- Epidemic dropsy is a form of edema of extremities due to poisoning by Argemone mexicana (Mexican prickly poppy).

Is caused by contamination of mustard oil with 'Argemone oil'

Toxin: 'Sanguinarine' is the toxin contained in argemone oil

  • Sanguinarine interferes with oxidation of 'pyruvic acid', which accumulates in blood: It may lead to sudden non-inflammatory edema of bilateral lower limbs, diarrhea, dyspnoea, cardiac failure and death; It can also lead to glaucoma; It may sometimes manifest as 'Sarcoids' (dilatation of skin capillaries)
  • Epidemic dropsy may occur in all ages except breast-fed infants.

Option (a): Neurolathyrism is caused by eating the pulse 'Khesari Dal (Lathyrus sativus)'; Diets containing over 30 % of this dal consumed over a period of 2 - 6 months result in neurolathyrism

  • Toxin present in lathyrus seeds is 'Beta oxalyl amino alanine (BOAA)'

Option (c): Endemic Ascites:

  • Toxin: Pyrrolizidine alkaloids (Hepatotoxins)
  • Adulterant: Crotolaria plant (Jhunjhunia)

Option (d): Ergotism: - Occurs due to food toxicant - ergot fungus 'Claviceps fusiformis'

  • Food items having a tendency for ergotism:
    • Bajra
    • Rye
    • Sorghum
    • Wheat
  • Removal of ergot:
    • Float them in 20% salt water
    • Hand-picking
    • Air-floatation
  • Upper safe limit for ergot: 0.05 mg per 100 grams food material

Reference: Park's Textbook of Preventive & Social Medicine,K.park,27th Edition, Page number:759-762

choices.text: Image (A) - It is used for identifying the species of the malarial parasite
Image (A) - It is not the established method of choice for diagnosing malaria in urban areas
Image (B) - Antibody detection by this test is the method of choice for diagnosing malaria in inaccessible and tribal areas
Image (B) - Bivalent type of this test was used for detecting Plasmodium falciparum and Plasmodium vivax

questions.text: The following two diagnostic techniques (A) and (B) were performed in a medical camp conducted for diagnosing malaria. Which is a true statement regarding these techniques?
questions.solution:
Image (A) is a thick blood smear and Image (B) is the Rapid Diagnostic Test

(RDT). Bivalent RDTs detect P. falciparum and P. vivax.

Thin blood smear is used to identify the particular infecting species. Thick blood smear is used to detect infection and estimate parasite concentration.

Antibody detecting Rapid Diagnostic Tests (RDTs) are not the method of choice anymore in diagnosing malaria in inaccessible and tribal areas. The Antigen detecting RDTs and blood smear examination are the recommended methods for diagnosis of malaria.

Note: According to the announcement by Union Health Ministry in April 2018, antibody detecting Rapid Diagnostic Tests (RDTs) for malaria is banned due to the high false-positive rates in endemic areas.

Reference: Park's Textbook of Preventive and Social Medicine 25th edition Page number: 286

choices.text: The indicator used is bromocresol purple
It is used to estimate free chlorine levels heal
It is used to estimate combined chlorine levels

questions.text: In your community medicine practicals, you are given an apparatus as shown in the image given below. Which of the following statements regarding the apparatus is true?
questions.solution:
The image given is that of a Horrock's apparatus. The indicator used in Horrock's apparatus is starch iodide.

Horrock's apparatus contains 6 white cups (200 ml each). 1 black cup with a circular mark, 2 metal spoons with 2 grams of bleaching powder in each, 7 glass stirring rods, 1 special pipette and 2 droppers. It is not useful in measuring free and combined chlorine. It estimates the chlorine demand of water and is used to calculate the amount of bleaching powder used to disinfect the well.

Horrock's Apparatus

  • Horrock's Apparatus is used to estimate the chlorine demand of water.This is widely used in the disinfection of wells to find out how much bleaching powder is required
    • Contents of this water-testing apparatus:
    • 6 white cups of 200 ml each and one black cup with a circular mark
    • 2 metal spoons (each holds 2g of bleaching powder)
    • 7 glass stirring rods and 1 special pipette
    • Two droppers
    • Starch-lodide indicator solution

Procedure:

  • Use 2g of bleaching powder to create a thin paste in the black cup. It is now called the Chlorine stock solution
  • The six white cups are filled with the water to be tested* Add one drop of the stock solution to the 1* cup, two drops to the 2nd * cup, three drops to the 3rd cup, and so on till adding six drops to the 6th cup.* Stir the cups and wait for half an hour.* Add 3 drops of starch-iodide indicator to each cup
  • Development of blue color in the apparatus indicates free residual chlorine.
  • The first cup which develops this color gives an estimate of the amount of bleaching powder needed to disinfect 455 Litres of the sample water.
  • Chlorine demand or the dose of bleaching powder required is given by (n x2) g for 455 liters of water, i.e., (n x 2) g of bleaching powder is required to disinfect 455 liters of water. Here, n represents the position of the cup (1, 2,3, etc.) that was first to show a distinct blue color.

Reference: Park's Textbook of Preventive and Social Medicine 25th edition Page number:789

choices.text: Vitamin B complex and vitamin K
Safflower oil and vitamin B complex

questions.text: A patient present with the following Skin finding. You would advise supplementation with which of the following?
questions.solution:
The image shows rough, dry skin suggestive of phrynoderma. It is treated by supplementation of safflower oil (rich in essential fatty acids) and vitamin B complex.

Phrynoderma or toad skin is a type of follicular hyperkeratosis. It is caused by a deficiency of vitamin E, B, A, C, and essential fatty acids.

Reference: Park's Textbook of Preventive and Social Medicine 25th edition Page number: 669

questions.text: Which agency of the UN gives funds for technical assistance and has the following as part of its logo?
questions.solution:
United Nations development programme (UNDP) is an agency of the UN that gives funds for technical assistance. It has the following logo.

Its main objective is to help poorer nations develop their human and natural resources to their potential.

Some other agencies of the UN include:

  • UNESCO - United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization
  • UNEP - United Nations Environment Programme
  • UNHCR - United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees

Reference: Park's Textbook of Preventive and Social Medicine 25th edition Page number: 986

choices.text: Malnutrition can be detected even before signs and symptoms appear
It provides an objective basis for policy making on child healthcare

It can be used to indicate proof of government aid

questions.text: Identify the false statement about the following tool :
questions.solution:
The given image shows a growth chart. It is not used as proof of government aid.

The uses of growth charts are as follows:

  • Growth monitoring and diagnosis - can detect malnutrition before clinical features appear
    • Educational tool - to teach parents about the importance of adequate feeding.
    • Objective basis for planning and policy-making on child healthcare.

Reference: Park's Textbook of Preventive and Social Medicine 25th edition Page number: 600

choices.text: Implemented by Ministry of Women & Child Development
It provides a cover of Rs. 5 lakhs per family per year for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization across public and private empanelled hospitals in India
NITI Aayog has played a critical role in shaping the above health scheme

questions.text: Which of the following statement is not true about the health scheme represented by above logo?
questions.solution:
POSHAN Abhiyaan was launched by the Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi on the occasion of the International Women’s Day on 8th March, 2018 from Jhunjhunu in Rajasthan.

POSHAN Abhiyaan is the Government of India's flagship programme to improve nutritional outcomes for children, adolescents, pregnant women and lactating mothers by leveraging technology, a targeted approach and convergence. POSHAN (Prime Minister's Overarching Scheme for Holistic Nourishment) Abhiyaan is not a programme but a Jan Andolan, and Bhagidaari, meaning "People's Movement." This programme incorporates inclusive participation of public representatives of local bodies, government departments of the state, social organizations and the public and private sector at large.

NITI Aayog has played a critical role in shaping the POSHAN Abhiyaan. The National Nutrition Strategy (NNS), released by NITI Aayog in September 2017, presented a microanalysis of the problems persisting in the nutrition domain and chalked out an in-depth strategy for course correction. Most of the recommendations presented in the strategy document were subsumed within the design of POSHAN Abhiyaan.

Option C.

  • PM-JAY is the world's largest health insurance/ assurance scheme fully financed by the government. It provides a cover of Rest. 5 lakhs per family per year for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization across public and private empanelled hospitals in India.

Reference: Park's Textbook of Preventive and Social Medicine 25th edition Page number:675

questions.text: A 44yr old patient presented with severe pain and deformity of left hip. X-ray showed severe arthritis of left hip and hence he was advised total hip replacement after multiple trials of conservative symptomatic treatment. During the surgery the femoral head cartilage was found as follows. Probable medical condition this patient may be having?
questions.solution:
Alkaptonuric arthritis (Ochronosis) - An inherited defect in enzyme system involved in metabolism of phenylalanine and tyrosine. As a result homogentisic acid is excreted in patient's urine. As a long term result, it accumulates in the cartilage and other connective tissues giving them black/brown discoloration. Joint symptoms occur after 40 years of age. Spine and shoulder joint are commonly affected. There may be evidence of pigment deposit in the sclera. Homogentisic acid is present in the urine, and results in the colour of the urine turning dark brown on standing (due to oxidation of homogentisic acid on exposure to air).

X-ray - disc space calcification, peri-articular calcification in large joints

Treatment same as that for osteoarthritis.

Reference: J. Maheshwari's 5th Edition of Essential Orthopaedics page number:294

choices.text: Procedure can be repeated with additional use of anti fibroblastics like 5-FU
It forms a filtering channel to the subconjunctival space
It maintains lower IOP even with the wound closure and healing with fibrosis and excessive scaring
Short length of canal of schlemm is excised

questions.text: All is correct about the procedure shown below except?
questions.solution:
Image shows trabeculectomy

  • involves the creation of a lamellar scleral flap, under which, a piece of sclera which includes a short length of the canal of Schlemm is excised
  • forms a filtering channel to the subconjunctival space and its efficacy depends upon two routes of drainage of the aqueous-through the canal of Schlemm and by a tran- scleral route to the subconjunctival spaces.
  • If the wound heals and excessive scar tissue seals the flap over the drainage hole, the pressure in the eye again rises.
  • the addition of antifibroblastic agents such as 5-FU or mitomycin-C, which are used to slow down the healing process.
  • If the surgeon feels that the wound may heal too rapidly and the risk of excessive fibrosis is high, as in young patients, people of African origin, those with inflammation or a history of previous eye surgery
  • Complications:
  • early postoperative period shallowing of the anterior chamber and hyphaema may be seen.
  • Late complications include bleb failure, blebitis or bleb leak.
  • accelerated cataractogenesis
  • Endophthalmitis

Reference: parsons 22/edition, section IV chapter 19. Glaucoma page number :306-307

choices.text: It occurs due to streptococcal infection
It is a common condition seen in patients with diabetes
It is a diagnosis of exclusion
Unilateral painless involvement seen in young patients

questions.text: Which is the correct statement regarding the disease shown below?
questions.solution:
Image shows Mooren ulcer

  • rare, degenerative, superficial ulcer, starting at the corneal margin and spreading circumferentially and axially over the whole of this tissue
  • Aetiology: The underlying cause is unknown.
  • autoimmune lysis of the epithelium with consequent release of collagenolytic
  • Symptoms: severe neuralgic pain and lacrimation.
  • Signs: commences as one or more grey infiltrates, which break down, forming small ulcers that spread and sooner or later coalesce.
  • Bilateral involvement with severe pain ('malignant') is more common in young adults
  • unilateral, less painful form is seen in elderly
  • Mooren ulcer is a diagnosis of exclusion after all other systemic disorders predisposing to marginal ulceration are ruled out.

Reference: parsons 22/edition, section IV chapter 15. Cornea page number:.210

choices.text: Silicon oil and pars plana vitrectomy and laser

questions.text: What is the treatment for the image shown below?
questions.solution:
The image depicts USG findings rhegmatogenous RD with proliferative vitreoretinopathy

  • Enucleation is done for Retinblastoma, or eye donation
  • Scleral buckling can be done for anterior RD and small RD
  • This appears to be a giant RD with severe PVR.

Retinal detachments:

  • exudation or traction because of another disease process in the eye
  • rhegmatogenous detachments due to the development of a break in the retina(rhegma-break)

Rhegmatogenous Retinal detachments

  • commonest type
  • Breaks can be round holes, horseshoe-shaped tears or retinal disinsertion at the ora (dialysis). Retinal tears are usually horse- shoe- or arrow-shaped with a lid-like tongue pulled inwards by the vitreous
  • they are most frequent at the periphery and commonest in the upper parts of the retina where the vitreous drags if it is adherent
  • Those involving more than a quadrant of the circumference are called giant retinal tears.

Reference: parson's 22/edition,section IV chapter 20 diseases of retina page number:.330-336

Reference: parsons 22/edition,section IV chapter 12. Posterior segment page number.145

It settles on its own in 1-5 yrs of onset
Diagnosis is confirmed by orbital USG
It can turn to malignant and threaten vision and ON

questions.text: What is false regarding the image shown below?
questions.solution:
• commonly capillary in the younger age group
  • cavernous haemangiomata in the elderly.
  • go through a phase of growth followed by involution within 1-5 years of onset.
  • Diagnosis is confirmed by orbital ultrasonography which demonstrates a poorly outlined lesion, with an irregular shape, high internal reflectivity and an irregular acoustic structure.
  • They are benign and can be treated by simple observation if there is no threat to vision.

Reference: parsons 22/edition, section VI chapter 30. Diseases of orbit page number :493

questions.text: A 30 year old male presented with multiple nodular lesions all over body. There was palmar and axillary freckling. Family history was positive in father. Which of the following is most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Patient in the image is showing multiple neurofibromas and Palmar freckling. Family history in father is also positive pointing towards diagnosis of NF-1

NF 1 is also known as Von recklinghausen's disease

Reference: Updated diagnostic criteria for NF 1 (2021)

questions.text: A 30 year old female patient presented with the lesions as shown in the figure. There was history of similar lesion in the past associated with fever. What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Herpes labialis is caused by HSV-1.

Patient presents with grouped vesicles around lips. Associated with fever. Tzanck smear shows multinucleated giant cells. Treatment: Tab. Acyclovir 400mg TDS for 7 days.

Impetigo is a common infection that is highly contagious and most commonly caused by gram-positive bacteria. It most commonly presents as honey coloured crust. Impetigo is a disease of children who reside in hot humid climates. Group A β-hemolytic Streptococcus (Streptococcus pyogenes) represents an important cause of non-bullous impetigo. It can lead to Post streptococcal glomerulonephritis.

Pemphigus vulgaris autoimmune bullous disease. Characterized by oral and genital erosion with fluid filled lesions (Vesicles and bulla) over skin which form erosions and crusting.

Chickenpox is a highly contagious viral infection that causes an acute fever and rash, mainly in children. Chickenpox is also known as varicella. Caused by varicella zoster virus, of the Herpesviridae family. Also called herpesvirus type 3.Lesions of chicken pox are polymorphic in nature (different morphology). Lesion starts as a papule which then become vesicle with erythematous base. Then the vesicle ruptures to form crusting.

Reference: Rook's textbook of dermatology, 9th edition, Page number- 25.18

questions.text: Identify the laryngoscopy grading by cormack Lehane?
questions.solution:
Widely accepted classification (of Cormack and Lehane) according to the best view possible at direct laryngoscopy :

  • grade 1: complete glottis visible.
  • grade 2: anterior glottis not seen.
  • grade 3: epiglottis seen but not glottis.
  • grade 4: epiglottis not seen.

Grades 3 and 4 together are often termed 'difficult'.

Reference: FRCA A TO Z, page number:324
